result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Orlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ offense [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-292 and 14CF-352.

8:40 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
14CF-292 Defendant is pleading to Count 1 and Count 2. Count 3 would be dismissed and read in
14CF-352 Dismissed and read in

Atty Bliss addresses the sentence after revocation sentence that Defendant is currently serving.
Atty Bliss concurs with agreement.
Defendant concurs with agreement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 14CF-292
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 14CF-292

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Bliss for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defendant acknowledges prior conviction.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-292 Count 1 Possession, Repeater
14CF-292 Count 2 Possession
14CF-292 Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-352 Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. This is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Bliss makes sentencing arguments to the Court. Defendant has been in custody since July.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court will follow plea agreement.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-292:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 Days
178 Days Credit, deemed served
Pay costs
Pay Drug Abues Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit to DNA test if not done so already
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 90 Days
178 Days Credit
Concurrent to Count 1
Pay costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Court will not order the DNA Surcharge on this count
Plea hearing on January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

10/20/14 - Amended to include that this bond now covers 14CF352.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski appeared by video. Attorney John M. Bliss in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Cousins indicates 14CF292 has a bond set and asks that that bond cover this case as well. 
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.
Pre-trial conference on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:20 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for an arraignment at this time.

Atty Bliss received a copy of the information, waives reading.
Preliminary hearing has been previously waived.
Court questions Atty Bliss regarding waiver.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Atty Bliss enters pleas of NOT GUILTY on all charges.

This case will have a pretrial conducted this morning.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Matter was to be heard in Br 2, but was moved to Br 3 and now rescheduled. There was a written waiver that was to be filed, but is not in the file.  DA office had informed the jail that they didn't need to bring the Defendant from jail today.
 Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski appeared by video. Attorney John M. Bliss in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Renc defendant is eligible for public defender but has not been assigned yet. BTC: Matter rescheduled.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Clerk is Shelley P.
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping - Felony, Possession of THC (2nd+) and Possess Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant makes statements. 
State requests a signature bond $1000.00  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  August 8, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
